word_mean: 环，圈，环状物：任何环形或圈形的器官或区域
用于特定解剖结构的名称。见annulus项下，另见circle和circulus
环：在化学中，指在连续或闭合链中联合的原子集合
孔道周围的细粒物质、晶体矿物等环状浓聚物，或由冻融分选形成粗骨颗粒的环状堆积物。

sentence.Network_en: If you'd like more information, ring the Hotline on 414 3929.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果想了解更多信息，请拨打热线电话4143929。

sentence.Network_en: Friendship is much more important to me than a stupid old ring!
sentence.Network_cn: 友谊对我来说可比一个破戒指重要得多！

sentence.Network_en: Any minute now, that phone is going to ring.

...的电影，都和小说相差得太悬殊，电影版只是小说版的第一部和第二部，电影里还没有表述最为关键的虚拟世界“环”，所以电影版只是从“环”界的一面描述整个事件，其实与小说版差异很大。世界观环界（ring）完整的午夜凶铃是发生在两个不同世界的故事，要说明午夜凶铃这个故事，必须要先从“环（ring）”说起

jx.jx_en_mean: monitor a dispute or conflict without becoming involved in it

phrase.cizu_name: run (或 make) rings round (或 around) someone
throw one's hat in the ring

jx.jx_en_mean: cause a theatre curtain to be lowered (or raised)

jx.jx_cn_mean: 回荡在耳边，留在记忆中

lj.lj_ly: he left Washington with the president's praises ringing in his ears.
lj.lj_ls: 他离开了华盛顿，耳边仍回响着总统的赞扬。

lj.lj_ly: he left Washington with the president's praises ringing in his ears.

jx.jx_en_mean: (N. Amer.)(of a telephone) be constantly ringing due to a large number of incoming calls
(Brit.)report or make contact, especially to or with one's place of work, by telephone

lj.lj_ly: every morning she coughed she rang in sick.
lj.lj_ls: 每天早晨她一咳嗽，就打电话给单位说病了。

jx.jx_en_mean: usher someone or something in (or out) by or as if by ringing a bell

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English hring, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch ring, German Ring, also to the noun rank
Old English hringan, of Germanic origin, perhaps imitative

encyclopedia.content: 环状系统 RING是环状系统的简称，完整名称是WUSCO RING SYSTEM，是吴仕企业管理咨询有限公司研发的企业管理系统。 RING环状系统的目的在对企业的通用管理版本，即任何一间企业都可使用环状系统来管理企业。 环状系统的结构特权级别 Intel的CPU将特权级别分为4个级别：RING0,RING1,RING2,RING3。Windows只使用其中的两个级别RING0和RING3，RING0只给操作系统用，RING3谁都能用。如果普通应用程序企图执行RING0指令，则Windows会显

entry.def: When you ring someone, you telephone them.

example.ex: He rang me at my mother's...
example.tran: 他打电话到我妈妈家找我。

example.ex: If you'd like more information, ring the Hotline on 414 3929...
example.tran: 如果想了解更多信息，请拨打热线电话414 3929。

entry.def: When a telephone rings, it makes a sound to let you know that someone is phoning you.

example.ex: As soon as he got home, the phone rang...
example.tran: 他一回到家，电话就响了。

example.ex: The phone never stopped ringing.
example.tran: 这部电话一直响个不停。

entry.def: When you ring a bell or when a bell rings, it makes a sound.

example.ex: He heard the school bell ring...
example.tran: 他听见学校的铃声响了。

example.ex: The door was opened before she could ring the bell.
example.tran: 她还没来得及按门铃，门就开了。

entry.def: If you ring for something, you ring a bell to call someone to bring it to you. If you ring for someone, you ring a bell so that they will come to you.

example.ex: Shall I ring for a fresh pot of tea?...
example.tran: 要我按铃叫一壶新沏的茶水吗？

example.ex: He rang for the guard to let him out.
example.tran: 他按铃叫保安放他出去。

entry.def: If you say that a place is ringing with sound, usually pleasant sound, you mean that the place is completely filled with that sound.

example.ex: The whole place was ringing with music.
example.tran: 整个地方都回荡着音乐。

entry.tran: (说法、讨论、辩论等的)特性，特点
entry.def: You can use ring to describe a quality that something such as a statement, discussion, or argument seems to have. For example, if an argument has a familiar ring, it seems familiar.

example.ex: His proud boast of leading 'the party of low taxation' has a hollow ring.
example.tran: 他洋洋得意地吹嘘自己领导着“一个主张低税收的政党”，这听起来很空洞。

entry.def: If you say that someone rings the changes, you mean that they make changes or improvements to the way something is organized or done.

example.ex: Ring the changes by adding spices, dried fruit or olives.
example.tran: 加点香料、干果或橄榄以换换口味。

entry.tran: 记忆犹新;在耳边回响;在脑海中浮现
entry.def: If you say that someone's words ring in your ears or ring in your head, you mean that you remember them very clearly, usually when you would prefer to forget them.

example.ex: She shivered as the sound of that man's abuse rang in her ears.
example.tran: 她耳边回响起那个男人的辱骂气得浑身发抖。

entry.def: If you give someone a ring, you phone them.

example.ex: We'll give him a ring as soon as we get back.
example.tran: 我们一回来就会给他打电话。

entry.tran: (说法)听起来真实/听起来空洞
entry.def: If a statement rings true, it seems to be true or genuine. If it rings hollow, it does not seem to be true or genuine.

example.ex: Joanna's denial rang true...
example.tran: 乔安娜的否认听起来像是真的。

example.ex: The rumpus has made all the optimistic statements about unity and harmony ring a little hollow.
example.tran: 这一番吵闹使得所有关于团结和谐的乐观言论听起来都显得有几分空洞。

entry.def: A ring is a small circle of metal or other substance that you wear on your finger as jewellery.

example.ex: She wore several diamond rings.
example.tran: 她戴了好几个钻石戒指。

example.ex: ...a gold wedding ring.
example.tran: 黄金婚戒

entry.def: An object or substance that is in the shape of a circle can be described as a ring .

example.ex: Frank took a large ring of keys from his pocket.
example.tran: 弗兰克从口袋里掏出一大串钥匙。

example.ex: ...a ring of blue smoke.
example.tran: 蓝色的烟圈

entry.def: A group of people or things arranged in a circle can be described as a ring .

example.ex: They then formed a ring around the square.
example.tran: 然后他们在广场周围围成了一圈。

example.ex: ...grilled fish surrounded by a ring of thinly cut carrots.
example.tran: 边上放着一圈薄胡萝卜片的烤鱼

entry.def: A gas or electric ring is one of the small flat areas on top of a stove which heat up and which you use for cooking.

entry.tran: 圆形竞技（或表演）场地;拳击台;摔跤台;马戏台
entry.def: At a boxing or wrestling match or a circus, the ring is the place where the contest or performance takes place. It consists of an enclosed space with seats round it.

example.ex: He will never again be allowed inside a British boxing ring.
example.tran: 他被永久禁止踏入英国拳击赛场。

entry.def: You can refer to an organized group of people who are involved in an illegal activity as a ring .

example.ex: Police are investigating the suspected drug ring at the school.
example.tran: 警方正在调查这所学校的可疑贩毒团伙。

example.ex: ...an international spy ring.
example.tran: 国际间谍组织

entry.tran: (建筑物或地方)用…围起来，被…环绕
entry.def: If a building or place is ringed with or by something, it is surrounded by it.

example.ex: The areas are sealed off and ringed by troops.
example.tran: 这些地区被军队封锁包围了。

entry.def: If you ring a bird, you put a small metal ring around its leg so that you can identify it and study its movements and habits.

example.ex: He demonstrated his techniques for ringing birds.
example.tran: 他展示了给鸟儿环志的技术。

entry.def: If you say that someone runs rings round you or runs rings around you, you mean that they are a lot better or a lot more successful than you at a particular activity.

example.ex: Mentally, he can still run rings round men half his age!
example.tran: 他在智力上仍远远高于那些比他年轻一半的人。

sentences.sentence: "a ring of ships in the harbor"

means.word_mean: 3. a rigid circular band of metal or wood or other material used for holding or fastening or hanging or pulling;

sentences.sentence: "there was still a rusty iron hoop for tying a horse"

means.word_mean: 4. (chemistry) a chain of atoms in a molecule that forms a closed loop

sentences.sentence: "police tried to break up the gang"

means.word_mean: 6. the sound of a bell ringing;

sentences.sentence: "the distinctive ring of the church bell"
"the tintinnabulation that so volumnously swells from the ringing and the dinging of the bells"--E. A. Poe

means.word_mean: 7. a square platform marked off by ropes in which contestants box or wrestle
8. jewelry consisting of a circlet of precious metal (often set with jewels) worn on the finger;

sentences.sentence: "he noted that she wore a wedding band"

means.word_mean: 9. a strip of material attached to the leg of a bird to identify it (as in studies of bird migration)
3. make (bells) ring, often for the purposes of musical edification;

sentences.sentence: "My uncle rings every Sunday at the local church"

means.word_mean: 5. get or try to get into communication (with someone) by telephone;

sentences.sentence: "I tried to call you all night"
"Take two aspirin and call me in the morning"

means.word_mean: 6. attach a ring to the foot of, in order to identify;

sentences.sentence: "band the geese to observe their migratory patterns"

list.explanation: 厚奖，发財机会，成功机遇

example.en: grab for the brass ring coming around
example.zh: 抓住送上门来的发财机会

example.en: He missed the brass ring at the last convention.
example.zh: 他在上次的大会上失去了获胜的良机。

slang.tokens: throw ones hat in the ring

example.en: The con claimed he needed parole so he coutd throw his hat in the ring for the mayoral election.
example.zh: 那囚犯要求假释，以使他能参加市长竞选。

example.en: Berle could do the same mugging bits and ring many more changes on them.
example.zh: 伯利也同样能演这些幽默节目，而且变换的花样比他们的还要多。

auth_sentence.content: Nobody is forced to get into a boxing ring.
auth_sentence.res_content: Nobody is forced to get into a boxing ring.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Nobody is forced to get into a boxing ring.

auth_sentence.content: They are chipstick trees that grow onion ring fruit.
auth_sentence.res_content: They are chipstick trees that grow onion ring fruit.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They are chipstick trees that grow onion ring fruit.

auth_sentence.content: Carefully remove the chefs' ring from each crumble.
auth_sentence.res_content: Carefully remove the chefs' ring from each crumble.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Carefully remove the chefs' ring from each crumble.

Sentence.sentence: And the phone hasn't stopped ringing.

sentences.en: He has a gold ring on his finger.
sentences.cn: 他手指上戴着一枚金戒指。

sentences.en: She wears a pair of pretty ear rings.
sentences.cn: 她戴着一副漂亮的耳环。

sentences.en: The auctioneers organized a secret ring to control the sales.
sentences.cn: 拍卖商们组织起一个秘密团伙来操纵货物的拍卖。

sentences.en: There was a ring at the door.
I will give you a ring tonight.
sentences.cn: 今天晚上我给你打电话。

sentences.en: There was a ring of sincerity in his promise.
sentences.cn: 他的许诺中有一种真诚的语气。

means.word_mean: 把…圈起来; 环绕; 包围

sentences.en: Ring the spelling mistakes with red ink.
sentences.cn: 用红墨水把拼写错误圈出来。

sentences.en: The man on duty rang an alarm.

sentences.cn: 是你按的铃吗, 先生?

sentences.en: Please ring the bell if you want anything.
sentences.cn: 你要是需要什么, 请按铃。

jushi.english: Rings are put round birds' legs to identify them.
jushi.chinese: 鸟腿上系了环以便识别。

jushi.english: He retired from the ring at 34.
jushi.chinese: 他在34岁时放弃了拳击生涯。

jushi.english: There was a ring of troops round the building.
jushi.chinese: 这座建筑物四周围着一圈士兵。
